head.title: DeKalb Co CTL United School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: The mission of DeKalb Central Schools is to develop socially responsible students who are literate, academically successful, engaged in all aspects of their education and prepared for success in the 21st century.

div.p: The mission of DeKalb Central Schools is to develop socially responsible students who are literate, academically successful, engaged in all aspects of their education and prepared for success in the 21st century.

article.aria-label: DeKalb Central Schools Closure Resource Page

h3.a: DeKalb Central Schools Closure Resource Page

div.div: Please check here for valuable information for our students, staff, and families here during our closure to help curtail the spread of COVID-19.
Please view this Important message from Superintendent Teders!

Over the course of several months, a total of 72 community members, DHS students, & district staff came together for four meetings to identify seven competencies that represent what we want our graduates to take with them on their life's journey.
The final visual representation of the Portrait of a Baron Graduate will serve as the guide for all in the district and community when thinking about hopes, dreams, and aspirations of our Baron graduates.
#BaronGrad #WeAreDeKalb
DeKalb Central Schools is made up of 4 elementary schools, 1 middle, and 1 high school with approximately 3600 students.
DeKalb Central's goal is to promote school spirit, loyalty, & fellowship among alumni, students, faculty, & staff through a variety of activities.

div.a: Notice Under the Americans with Disabilities Act

div.div: DeKalb County Central United School District is committed to equal opportunity and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, creed, sex, handicapping conditions, or national origin including limited English proficiency, in any employment opportunity. No person is excluded from participation in, denied the benefits of, or otherwise subjected to unlawful discrimination on such basis under any educational program or student activity. For further information, clarification, or complaint (grievance) procedures, please contact our Administration office (260-920-1011)
